file_content.text: Greetings, Commander. Can I help you?
Greetings. I am not the first Mystic you have met?
There is much work to be done.
[Investigate] I thought it was extremely rare for any Voss to ever leave their homeworld--let alone one of the Mystics.
Correct. My decision was not made lightly.
My vision was given to five different interpreters. All five interpretations aligned. Thus, I am here.
When my vision showed I must take many Voss, seek an Outsider, and enter a war, great caution was exercised.
[Investigate] I thought the visions of a Mystic could never be wrong. Why all the caution?
Visions cannot be wrong. Interpreters can. We eliminated that chance. The way forward was made clear.
Well, I'm glad to have your help.
I still can't believe you'd leave everything and fly out into the galaxy over some dream you had.
The Mystics see, and the Voss respond.
Your gratitude is unnecessary.
So what is it that you do here?
I'm sorry that you had to leave everything behind to help us.
Why? It must be so.
We do what we must to protect Voss.
[Investigate] Remind me about Voss Mystics again?
Ah. Juvard said the stasis may have damaged your mind.
Yes. Juvard Illip Oggurobb. Have I mistaken his name?
Hylo calls him "Doctor Hutt", despite his obvious irritation. I do not understand why.
Juvard?
[Say Nothing]
My head is fine!
This upsets you. I shall move on.
To your question: there are Voss who see events to come. These are Mystics.
Mystics share their visions with an interpreter, who deciphers their meanings.
The Voss then act upon the vision.
Whatever. Just don't get in our way.
I will not be in your way.
As was seen, we have built an enclave for those gifted in the Force. Here they will meditate, train, and grow.
I also meditate, awaiting visions of those who will yet join us.
Wait... your plan is to have Jedi and Sith training openly with one another? That's a recipe for disaster.
There will be conflicts. Tempers will flare. The enclave will survive it and grow stronger.
Your concerns are misplaced.
How can you oversee the training of arts you don't understand?
The vision was clear. This is my place.
I have also brought several Voss training in the Force. Some proficient, some beginners, all learning.
I'm grateful for any assistance--is there any more the Voss could contribute?
We're facing down the Eternal Empire, and this is all the Voss could spare? Pitiful.
The Alliance is honored to have your support.
Many more volunteered. I brought what the vision showed.
Thank you, but gratitude is unnecessary.
The enclave must grow, but it requires your support to do so.
I meditate. My visions reveal those who might join. You will attempt to recruit them.
My visions also showed many artifacts and Force relics gathered here. The task of retrieving them also falls to you.
With the relics, we will learn and grow. Our alliance will spread across the stars.
I must return to meditation. As Outsiders like to say: good luck.
How are things going around here?
We have barely started down our path. There remains much to do.
The few we have, train. I search for the many we have yet to find.
The enclave grows. Our pace is slower than I assumed.
Commander. When a Mystic sees, the Voss respond. But Outsiders challenge the vision.
This is not unexpected of Outsiders, but it slows growth. We must grow to fulfill our purpose.
Doesn't that include you, too? You should try to learn about "Outsiders" and understand them better.
An interesting interpretation.
What does it matter? Don't your visions show us it's already going to work out?
Visions do not fulfill themselves. Ignoring visions invites disaster. This is why the Voss respond.
I must think upon this further.
You're the one in charge here. If they're out of line, discipline them until they listen.
I have been stern. It does not work.
Our growth continues.
We must focus our efforts. Otherwise, we may not build the envisioned enclave.
I have been reflecting upon my time here... upon the difficulty of working with Outsiders... upon why it is difficult.
Among the Voss, being a Mystic is a great honor. However, I have also come to realize it is very... isolating.
Those who stand out from others often wind up standing apart.
Like they always say, it's lonely at the top.
Please tell me you're not planning on whining as a status update....
Wise words. However, this is not quite what I attempt to convey.
What do you mean?
I am not attempting to "whine". This is simply difficult to convey.
As a Mystic, one sees. A Mystic does not interpret. A Mystic does not choose.
Here, I have no interpreter. I reflect upon matters and decide for myself. For the first time, I choose.
As I have reflected upon this, some of the actions of Outsiders around me have seemed... less strange....
I'm glad to hear that you're understanding us better.
Forgive my tangent, Commander. I did not mean to take so much of your time.
Good. Think for yourself. Let your own feelings and emotions be your guide.
Don't look now, but I think you're turning into an Outsider!
You jest, but were I to ever return to Voss....
Perhaps... I am unsure. I must reflect further.
Perhaps I shall try this. I must reflect further.
Commander. We should discuss the enclave.
The Force Enclave now matches what was seen in my vision.
That's great news!
There is still much we can do to grow further. But this achievement also represents a personal milestone.
In reaching this point, we have fulfilled the last interpreted vision I had to guide my path. Henceforth, my actions will be exclusively of my own interpretation. My own choice....
Finally. That took long enough....
Indeed. It can be difficult to predict the length of undertakings.
I feel conflicted, yet at the same time... excited.
Yes, Commander, we have accomplished much.
Xalek has arrived. Thank you for your assistance.
He speaks little, though his skills are considerable.
His assistance will strengthen us.
You have found the unconventional Jedi.
The Jedi embrace the Force through focus, calmness, and clarity. Emotions are an obstacle.
Guss does not follow their path. Some Jedi might call his methods dark. But Guss is not consumed by darkness.
Is it more subtle? Has Guss has found a third path all his own?
Guss lends unique perspective. Breadth is strength to the enclave.
Now--concerning the one who trained Guss....
My visions of him were... strange... unclear. I felt he was seeing me through my vision somehow. It is not something I have felt before.
I do not know who he is, but he is powerful. Use caution.
Remind me: what sorts of things can I do to help the enclave?
We build an enclave for study and practice of the Force. We mostly require two things.
First, artifacts and other relics to study. Bring what you find, and we shall use them.
Second, we must recruit more Force-sensitives. Such persons will be rare, but my meditations will reveal them to us in time.
I will send word to you when I see potential.
That's all for now.
Very well.
Is there anything else, Commander?
[Turn In Ancient Artifacts] I've found some relics for the enclave.
Good. Our strength will grow.
[Turn in More Ancient Artifacts]
[Back]
Commander. C2-N2 is disrupting our enclave.
He modified our food processors to produce unwelcome meals. Please stop this.
Commander. C2-N2 is leaving food in the enclave.
This is unnecessary. Distracting. Please stop it.
Commander. C2-N2 brought cushions and padded our seats.
The padding reduces discomfort and distraction. Thank it for us.
The enclave smells strange. We believe C2-N2 is attempting to help.
Please stop these distractions.
Who knows? Who cares? All this Force nonsense is your responsibility.
Paths to the dark side can be subtle at first. But the dark side is dangerous. If Guss does not gain control of himself, things will not end well for him.
All the dark siders I've met were trouble. Guss could be headed that way without even knowing it.
I believe he is walking a subtler path to the dark side. In the end, he will be stronger for it.
His master certainly has no love lost for the Jedi Order, but I don't think Guss walks a dark path... just his own.
I really don't care, so long as he helps us fight the Eternal Empire.
Maybe he really has found a different way. He could reach a lot of people that the Jedi Order or the Sith Empire never could.
We have made much progress, though there remains much to do.
Though the path from here is unknown, I believe we must continue to build and grow. As we do, we shall both see where this path leads.
You have returned without Xalek.
Xalek is dead.
Yeah, about that. I kind of wound up killing him.
Our alliance doesn't need someone like Xalek.
I taught him one final lesson about respecting his betters.
He was on a rampage murdering civilians. He had to be stopped.
Xalek wasn't interested in joining the Alliance.
People who attack me usually don't wind up living very long.
When I told him I wouldn't duel him, he walked away.
Understood. It is your vision that must guide us. I shall continue my search.
First I've met in person, actually.
I am honored.
